caption.title: Changes in protein expression between metformin- and insulin-treated cells.

td.bold: proteins (12) with differential expression compared to untreated controls (|log
FC| ≥ 0.5) that were regulated by metformin and hyperinsulinemia in the same way

tr.td: COL1A1, EGFR, FLOT1, IL1B, IL2, IL15, IRS2, KDR, RP9, S100B

td.bold: proteins (8) with significantly differential expression compared to untreated controls (|log
FC| ≥ 0.5 and p ≤ 0.05) that were significantly higher expressed after metformin treatment compared to hyperinsulinemia

tr.td: CTSL, F3, GUSB, LGALS1, LGMN, NT5E, PI3, PLAUR

td.bold: proteins (24) with significantly differential expression compared to untreated controls (|log
FC| ≥ 0.5 and p ≤ 0.05) that were significantly higher expressed during hyperinsulinemia compared to metformin treatment

tr.td: AMFR, CCND2, CD63, CDCP1, CDH5, CEACAM8, EGF, ERBB3, ETS2, EZR, GDF15, GPX4, IRF4, MPP3, PLCG2, SELE, SIGLEC5, SORL1, SPP1, THBS1, TM9SF2, VEGFA, VTCN1, WNT2B

td.bold: proteins (8) without differential expression compared to untreated controls (|log
FC| < 0.5), but with significantly differential expression between metformin treatment and hyperinsulinemia

tr.td: ERBB3, ETS2, GDF15, GPX4, LGALS1, LGMN, NT5E, THBS1

fn.p: A total of 44 proteins were differentially expressed between metformin and insulin-treated groups, of which only 12 proteins were regulated in the same way. The remaining 32 proteins were regulated in different ways by metformin and insulin, of which 8 proteins were significantly higher expressed after metformin administration, whereas 24 proteins were significantly more prominent during hyperinsulinemia. A total of 8 proteins were differentially expressed between both treatments groups without notable changes compared to the respective untreated control samples.
